document.docAuthor: Barahona-Segovia, Rodrigo M., Riera, Pamela, Pañinao-Monsálvez, Laura, Guzmán, Vicente Valdés & Henríquez-Piskulich, Patricia
document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 71–73. Philippimyia cyanocephalus (Philippi, 1865): (71) lateral view (Photo by Patricia Henríquez); (72) dorsal view (Photo by Vicente Valdés) and (73) in situ feeding on Rubus ulmifolius Schott in Oken (Photo by Ricardo Varela). Scale bars = 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality and data.
“ Santiago , Chile ” (T, A, MNHNCL )
.

Chilean distribution. From Valparaíso to Los Lagos region ( Fig. 79 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to precordillera ecosystems (10– 1,000 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes.
Philippimyia cyanocephalus
is a species associated with native forests. The first live record was observed recently in the exotic shrub
R. ulmifolius
(Ricardo Varela, CSP record, Fig. 73 ). Other biological and ecological aspects of this species are unknown.
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 128,991 km 2 ; AOO = 88 km 2 and 20 localities (or subpopulations).
